subclusters.subcluster_name: Telomere Shortening and Cellular Senescence Theory
Immune System Telomere Attrition and Aging Theory
Telomere Position Effect and Gene Regulation Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere Shortening and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on telomere shortening as a mitotic clock causing replicative senescence and aging, with emphasis on telomerase activity and species-specific telomere dynamics.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere Shortening and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes telomere shortening as a mitotic clock leading to cellular senescence, with telomerase modulation and cell type differences in telomere dynamics.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere Shortening and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes telomere attrition triggering senescence and SASP, with shelterin complex role and telomerase activity in proliferative cells.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere Shortening and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on telomere shortening as a molecular clock limiting replicative capacity and tumor suppression via senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere Shortening and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details telomere erosion causing replicative senescence, DNA damage response activation, and tissue dysfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere Shortening and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights telomerase insufficiency causing telomere shortening and replicative senescence, with tissue-specific effects and genetic defects.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere Shortening and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes telomere structure, end replication problem, telomere shortening as mitotic clock, and telomerase role in aging and cancer.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere Shortening and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on telomeres as chromosome end protectors, shortening as mitotic clock, and telomere dysfunction triggering senescence and crisis.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere Shortening and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes telomere shortening limiting proliferation, inducing senescence, impairing stem cells, and causing organismal aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere Shortening and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes telomere erosion triggering replicative senescence and links telomerase activity to cancer and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere Shortening and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details telomere shortening as mitotic clock, telomerase repression in somatic cells, and senescence/crisis phases.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere Shortening and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Covers telomere structure, end replication problem, telomerase activity, and tumor suppression via senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere Shortening and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on telomere shortening causing senescence, telomere uncapping, DNA damage response, and shelterin protein roles.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere Shortening and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Discusses telomere shortening driving replicative senescence, telomerase regulation, and telomere-binding proteins in hematopoietic progenitors.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere Shortening and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes telomere shortening causing chromosomal instability, senescence, SASP, and oxidative stress-induced apoptosis.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere Shortening and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights telomere shortening as intrinsic aging mechanism, DNA damage checkpoint activation, and stem cell aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere Shortening and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on telomere shortening as biological clock, telomerase role in maintenance, and balance between senescence and tumorigenesis.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Immune System Telomere Attrition and Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on telomere shortening in immune cells causing immunosenescence and links to rheumatic diseases.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Immune System Telomere Attrition and Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes telomere length as biomarker and driver of aging, with lifestyle modulation affecting telomere shortening and healthspan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Immune System Telomere Attrition and Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes exercise-induced telomerase activation preserving telomere length and modulating aging via immune cell telomere biology.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Immune System Telomere Attrition and Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes leukocyte telomere length dynamics, synchrony across tissues, and partitioning of inherited vs attrition components.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Non-Replicative Cell Telomere Attrition Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Shows telomere shortening in non-dividing neurons causing senescence-like phenotypes independent of replication.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere Position Effect and Gene Regulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on telomere shortening altering chromosomal looping and subtelomeric gene expression contributing to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere Position Effect and Gene Regulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes telomere length-dependent chromatin looping regulating gene expression over long distances, affecting aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Short Telomere-Mediated Degenerative Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes inherited short telomeres causing systemic degenerative defects and aging phenotypes independent of telomerase mutations.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere Dysfunction-Induced Senescence (TDIS) Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on telomeres as sensors of genotoxic stress triggering persistent DNA damage response and tumor-suppressive senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere Shortening-Induced Apoptosis-to-Senescence Switch Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes p53 and mTOR/AKT pathway-mediated switch from apoptosis to senescence upon telomere shortening during aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Stress-Accelerated Telomere Shortening Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights oxidative stress accelerating telomere shortening and destabilizing t-loop, triggering p53-dependent senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replication Fork Collapse and WRN Deficiency Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on WRN helicase deficiency causing replication fork collapse, genomic instability, and premature senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere-Mediated Tumor Suppression and Inflammation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links telomere shortening-induced senescence and crisis to tumor suppression and proinflammatory SASP contributing to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Shelterin Dysfunction and Telomere Shortening Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes shelterin complex dysfunction causing telomere uncapping, DNA damage response activation, and premature senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Estrogen Regulation of Telomerase Activity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes estrogen-mediated upregulation of telomerase activity via receptor and signaling pathways affecting aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere-Mitochondrial Axis of Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on telomere shortening inducing mitochondrial dysfunction via p53 repression of mitochondrial biogenesis regulators.
